   - Marit Bjørgen is a former Norwegian cross-country skier who has achieved great success in the sport.

   - Bjørgen's dominance in cross-country skiing has made her one of the most successful athletes in the sport's history.

4. **Nikolai Andrianov**:
   - Nikolai Andrianov was a Soviet gymnast who held the record for the most Olympic medals by a man until Michael Phelps surpassed him.
   - He won a total of 15 Olympic medals, including 7 gold medals, and is considered one of the greatest gymnasts in history.
   - Andrianov's achievements in gymnastics have left a lasting impact on the sport and inspired future generations of gymnasts.

5. **Ole Einar Bjørndalen**:
   - Ole Einar Bjørndalen is a retired Norwegian biathlete and cross-country skier who has achieved remarkable success in both sports.

<fragment>

**Michael Fred Phelps II[5]** (born June 30, 1985)[6] is an American former competitive swimmer. He is the most successful and most decorated Olympian of all time[7] with a total of 28 medals.[8] Phelps also holds the all-time records for Olympic gold medals (23),[9] Olympic gold medals in individual events (13), and Olympic medals in individual events (16).[10] At the 2004 Summer Olympics in Athens, Phelps tied the record of eight medals of any color at a single Games, held by gymnast Alexander Dityatin, by winning six gold and two bronze medals. Four years later, when he won eight gold medals at the 2008 Beijing Games, he broke fellow American swimmer Mark Spitz's 1972 record of seven first-place finishes at any single Olympic Games. At the 2012 Summer Olympics in London, Phelps won four gold and two silver medals, and at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, he won five gold medals and one silver. This made him the most successful athlete of the Games for the fourth Olympics in a row.[11][12]

**Marit Bjørgen** (born 21 March 1980) is a former Norwegian cross-country skier. She is ranked first in the all-time Cross-Country World Cup rankings with 114 individual victories. Bjørgen is also the most successful sprinter in Cross-Country World Cup history, with 29 victories. She headed the medal table at the 2010 Winter Olympics by winning five medals, including three gold. A five-time Olympian, her five Olympic medals at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games brought her total number of medals up to a record 15, the most by any athlete in Winter Olympics history.[2]

<fragment>
He held the record for men for the most Olympic medals at 15 (7 gold medals, 5 silver medals, 3 bronze medals) until Michael Phelps surpassed him at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics. Andrianov is the third athlete (male or female) in cumulative Olympic medals after Phelps's 28 and Larisa Latynina's 18. Andrianov won the most medals at the 1976 Summer Olympics with 6 individual medals and one team medal. Within the sport of Men's Artistic Gymnastics, he also holds the men's record for most individual Olympic medals (12) and shares the male record for most individual Olympic gold medals in gymnastics (6) with Boris Shakhlin and Dmitry Bilozerchev (the latter of which only if you count the 1984 Alternate Olympics).

I have gathered information about the following athletes:

1. **Michael Phelps**:
   - Michael Fred Phelps II is an American former competitive swimmer, the most successful and most decorated Olympian of all time.
   - He holds the all-time records for Olympic gold medals, gold medals in individual events, and medals in individual events.
   - Phelps has won a total of 28 Olympic medals, including 23 gold medals.
   - He has set numerous records and achievements in swimming, making him one of the greatest swimmers in history.

2. **Larisa Latynina**:
   - Larisa Latynina is a former Soviet gymnast who held the record for the most career Olympic medals until Michael Phelps surpassed her.
   - She is considered one of the greatest gymnasts of all time, winning a total of 18 Olympic medals.
   - Latynina's achievements in gymnastics have solidified her legacy as a legendary athlete in the sport.

3. **Marit Bjørgen**:
   - Marit Bjørgen is a former Norwegian cross-country skier who has achieved great success in the sport.
   - She has won multiple Olympic gold medals and is ranked first in the all-time Cross-Country World Cup rankings.
   - Bjørgen's dominance in cross-country skiing has made her one of the most successful athletes in the sport's history.

4. **Nikolai Andrianov**:
   - Nikolai Andrianov was a Soviet gymnast who held the record for the most Olympic medals by a man until Michael Phelps surpassed him.
   - He won a total of 15 Olympic medals, including 7 gold medals, and is considered one of the greatest gymnasts in history.
   - Andrianov's achievements in gymnastics have left a lasting impact on the sport and inspired future generations of gymnasts.

5. **Ole Einar Bjørndalen**:
   - Ole Einar Bjørndalen is a retired Norwegian biathlete and cross-country skier who has achieved remarkable success in both sports.
   - He has won numerous Olympic medals and World Championships titles, establishing himself as one of the greatest biathletes of all time.
   - Bjørndalen's exceptional skills and achievements have earned him a place among the legends of winter sports.

Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.
